entries.title: President Trump denied that he was planning to attempt to fire Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell after polling Republican lawmakers during a closed-door meeting about whether he should oust him
President Trump lashed out at his supporters for opposing the decision not to release more material from the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and accused them of buying into a Democratic narrative
Senate Republicans narrowly advanced a slimmed-down $9 billion package of spending cuts that preserves funding for AIDS treatments in Africa
Zohran Mamdani said he would discourage the use of the slogan “globalize the intifada” in a roughly hourlong meeting with some of New York City’s most powerful executives
The Trump administration is attempting to make millions of immigrants living in the country illegally ineligible to be released from detention on bond as they fight their deportation cases
The new type of savings account for children that made it into the One Big Beautiful Bill Act changed as it moved through Congress. Observers are still trying to make sense of it
Trump is betting that constantly shifting tariff strategy can remake global trade, but his strategy faces risks
President Trump on Monday waded back into a controversy over Joe Biden’s use of an autopen to grant pardons during his final days in the White House. Here’s what we know about the clash.
The Supreme Court on Monday allowed the Trump administration to begin mass layoffs at the Education Department, halting a lower-court ruling that had blocked the White House’s plans indefinitely
President Trump said the U.S. will send Patriot air-defense systems to Ukraine that will be paid for by the European Union, and he again criticized Russian leader Vladimir Putin
President Trump traveled to the site of the Texas floods with two missions—to console, and to tout a new response to disasters where Washington takes a back seat to state and local responders
Andrew Cuomo Will Run in NYC Mayor’s General Election as an Independent
Joe Biden’s debate against Donald Trump was supposed to prove the aging president’s stamina. But in the weeks leading up to it he was devastated—and distracted—by his son Hunter’s legal travails.
President Trump traveled to the heart of the Everglades for a tour of a newly constructed migrant detention center—and a reunion with one of his fiercest political rivals, Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis
Zohran Mamdani cemented his win over Andrew Cuomo in New York City’s Democratic mayoral primary, notching a 12-point victory in ranked-choice voting results released Tuesday
Before Rep. Don Bacon departs Congress, the Nebraska centrist lawmaker must decide how to vote on President Trump’s megabill
A memo by Elbridge Colby, the Pentagon’s top policy official, highlighting U.S. weapons shortages influenced the decision to pause some arms shipments to Ukraine
President Trump said the U.S. would resume providing Ukraine with arms to help it withstand Russian attacks after months of trying without success to draw Moscow into negotiations on ending the war

A declassified CIA report weakened an earlier finding that Russia’s Vladimir Putin had “aspired” to help elect Donald Trump in 2016, supporting Trump’s longstanding claim that the Kremlin played no role in his victory
The U.S. has stopped the delivery of air-defense interceptors and other weapons intended for Ukraine and is using them instead to beef up Pentagon stocks
Some analysts say President Trump doesn’t appear to have a clear foreign-policy worldview, but White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt said he practices “purposeful strategic ambiguity”
